title: Riviera police: Gunmen who injured 3 fire again, ‘extremely dangerous’
content:
Three people, including two teenagers, were injured Saturday at about noon in a drive-by shooting on West 36th Street, Riviera Beach police said.
Police say a 14-year-old male, a 17-year-old female and a 25-year-old man were shot by a passing vehicle at about 12:30 just west of President Barack Obama Highway and south of Silver Beach Road. At least two people were in the vehicle, police said, and fled after the shooting.
The three were taken to a hospital with non-life threatening injuries, police said.
Two hours later, the same suspects shot at homes and cars near the intersection of West Third Street and Avenue O, about two miles south of the first incident, police said. No one was injured in the second shooting, which happened at about 2:40 p.m.
Anyone with information is urged to contact Riviera Beach police at 561-845-4123 or Crime Stoppers of Palm Beach County at 800-458-TIPS (8477) as soon as possible. The suspects are armed, police warn, and should be considered extremely dangerous.
